title: (x) Name that serif! - Adobe serif {Tiff}
content:
![mystery serif](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518052120im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/25707.jpg)   
   
This one's been rattling my brain for a view days. This typeface looks very familiar but I can't place it. Anyone?   
   
kristin
author: kristin

comments.content: Funny, I was just reading [this](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518052120/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/3075.html) thread when this post came up ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518052120im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)

I think you're right, Tiffany. I wonder what font it's pretending to be? The italic is very narrow.   
   
This reminds me of a Scott Kim (I think) puzzle in _Publish_ magazine a few years back. He showed samples where the Adobe substitute fonts had replaced well-known typefaces. The idea was to identify what the missing font was.

Tiff, you are the best. And thanks, franz, for the link. According to the Word doc my friend sent, this was supposed to be ITC Garamond. The italic was an oblique of the Garamond.   
   
Weird.
